content.description: Stick clip and climb through the blocky roof (v7ish?) continue up a beautiful 5.11 arete with some heart breaking cruxes, in the guidebook as a project. Start is harder for short folk, no anchor.
content.location: Large roof leading into an arete on the right side of crag

content.description: Spectacular arete that is the first route located on the left of the wall. Climb on good edges past 5 bolts. A  medium cam protects the finish.
content.protection: 5 bolts. Optional medium size cam on easy ground at the top. Fixed anchor at the top of the climb.
content.location: first route on the left of the crag.

content.description: Crimpy face climbing on good rock with fun movement. There is a pin but it has been recently replaced by a bolt a foot above.
content.protection: 6 Bolts (Pin is no longer used). Two bolt anchor.
content.location: Bolted route just to the right of Stratocaster.

content.description: Though one of Acadia's more obscure crags it hosts a good collection of routes with climbs ranging from 5.9+ to 5.12. A great cliff if your looking to beat the crowds at Otter Cliffs or the South Wall.
